comments:
This happens to both EAR 1.4 and EAR 5 project. If there are no modules included to the EAR, it cannot be exported successfully. 

Steps to reproduce: 
1. Create an EAR project (version 1.4 or 5). Do not include any j2ee modules to this ear. 
2. Call "Export --> EAR file" action. The "EAR Export" wizard appears.
3. Fill the necessary fields and click Finish. 
4. The wizard crashes with the following error:

hey Jason, am taking a closer look at anything publish/export related to see if my recent changes might be involved; looks like the divide by zero error is due to the following line in EARComponentExportOperation that got added during some progress bar work you did recently on this file (I believe that version is in both 2.0 and 1.5.x):

...
int work = (JAVA_BUILDER_WORK + LIB_BUILDER_WORK) / refs.length + 1; 
..

Not clear on the severity here given the use case (a no-module, and therefore non-valid, EAR)

Created an attachment (id=62386)
patch

Avoids divide by 0

This is a very simple, low risk fix.  The work variable is supposed to be the amount of work to build each project; i.e. the ear plus all its modules, so, it should be clear that the parenthesis' are necessary to properly compute this, and they also avoid the divide by 0.  This has been tested by me using the UI to export several ear projects.  I also did a search of other files affected by my recent progress monitor support and didn't find any other potential divide by 0 errors.
the patch dated 2007-03-29 10:17 has been applied to the 2.0 stream.

Hi Jason, 

Thank you for the quick resolution. I want to ask is the patch going to be released with the next declared I-build (tomorrow?), or I have to wait for next week's I-build. 

I have to check the fix in our (SAP) codebase and we are currently integrating the latest declared I-build.

Greetings, 
Kaloyan
Yes, I think it will make it into tomorrow's 2.0 IBuild.
Verified in WTP 2.0 with the I200703301651 build.
